Authors:
Jie Chen, Philippe Callac, Jacques Guinberteau, Kevin D
Hyde, Ruilin Zhao
Title:
Hymenagaricus septocystidiatus, a new species from Thailand
and its phylogenetic position within the family Agaricaceae
Abstract:
The novel species Hymenagaricus septocystidiatus is
described and illustrated from Thailand based on both morphological and
molecular data. It is characterized by brown, minute, punctiform scales,
around the large scales at the centre of the pileus, the stipe with
concolourous fibrils, a strong reddening when bruised and cut, and
microscopically, the variable shaped cheilocystidia, with 0â“3 septa in
developing stage. The phylogenetic results based on ITS and nrLSU
sequences suggest that Hymenagaricus is paraphyletic and has a close
relationship with Heinemannomyces. The results also provide preliminary
molecular evidence supporting the elevation of subgenera Hymenagaricus
and Xanthagaricus to the genera rank.
